Title: Data Center-Disaster Recovery Center (DC-DRC) for High Availability IT Service
Source title: Proceedings of 2018 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2018
Affiliations: Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University Jakarta, BINUS Graduate Program-Master of Computer Science11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Dhanujati, N., Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University Jakarta, BINUS Graduate Program-Master of Computer Science11480, Indonesia; Girsang, A.S., Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University Jakarta, BINUS Graduate Program-Master of Computer Science11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Currently, the companies are required to have conducting business activities and continue constantly in touch with its customers to provide IT service availability continuously. The systems must be available at all times with an ever-on-The-job system, requiring a high availability system to keep the service operable 24×7×365. This issue brings the disaster recovery plan (DRP) becomes an important issue for the data and IT infrastructure. This is a very potential risk because the data will be constantly threatened by disturbance such as viruses, hackers or disasters such as natural disasters. This paper explains the concept rather than disaster recovery service planning and database replication. This study covers the evaluation, planning, implementation and testing of the disaster recovery solution. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: business continuity; disaster recovery plan; high availability; recovery
Index Keywords: Information management; Personal computing; Recovery; Viruses; Business activities; Business continuity; Database replication; Disaster recovery centers; Disaster recovery plan; High availability; High availability systems; IT infrastructures; Disasters
